job.name: Memory_File_Trigger

variable.name: HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the server

variable.name: FOLDER_TO_MONITOR
variable.description: Folder on the given HOST that will be monitored for new files presence

variable.name: FILENAME_PATTERN_TO_MONITOR
variable.description: Only filenames which match the supplied regular expression will be considered

variable.name: CHANNEL_TRIGGERED_ID
variable.description: Name of the channel in synchronization api that will be used by this workflow

variable.name: CALLED_WORKFLOW
variable.description: Workflow to submit from the ProActive Catalog

variable.name: FOUND_FILE_VARIABLE_NAME
variable.description: Name of the variable that will be given as input to the submitted workflow. The value of this variable will contain the processed file name

job.description: This workflow monitors a folder (FOLDER_TO_MONITOR) on a given HOST. It searches for files according to the pattern FILENAME_PATTERN_TO_MONITOR and for each file found, it will submit a catalog workflow to the scheduler (CALLED_WORKFLOW). The submitted workflow will receive as parameter the found file path.The name of this parameter can be customized using FOUND_FILE_VARIABLE_NAME. The MemoryFileTrigger workflow is stateful and behaves using a loop structure. It will memorize at each iteration the files already found to avoid retriggering new workflow execution for files already monitored. This state is implemented using ProActive Synchronization API and uses the CHANNEL_TRIGGERED_ID synchronization channel. By default it uses the MemoryFileTrigger job id to make sure the memory is reset when resubmitting the MemoryFileTrigger job.
